channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: El Duvelle
item.description:
Hey all, still as part of the #MoveToMasto Movement, and because we‚Äôre a bunch of honest people, let‚Äôs list all the things we think could be improved here on #Mastodon:
(I‚Äôll start - in no specific order)
(See this other post for the positive aspects)[1] You don‚Äôt know if people boost or even like your boosts
[2] You can‚Äôt easily see all the answers to someone else‚Äôs post
[3] Sometimes you find a potentially great account to follow just to realize they haven‚Äôt been active for a year
[4] Threads and answers visualization is sometimes unclear
[5] You can very easily miss very relevant content (the possibility of a customizable algorithm would help)
[6] (very specific to me) there are not enough #BehaviouralNeuroscience or #NeuroEthology people
[7] the new search is great but doesn‚Äôt search ALL of Mastodon‚Äôs public posts
[8] ‚Ä¶?Please do add your own!

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: üö®#ComplexityThought: 2023 Influential Papers CollectionThanks for reading us in 2023 and for being an active community. In the next Special Issue you will find recommendations from readers and more.See you again in 2024!https://open.substack.com/pub/manlius/p/complexity-thought-2023-influential?r=n4iyo&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web&showWelcome=true

item.title: conda
item.description:
Conda is moving our social media presence from Twitter/X to Mastodon and LinkedIn at the start of 2024. It's past time to move into spaces that are welcoming and more in line with our community values. Going forward, you can find us at
üêò @conda (https://fosstodon.org/@conda) on Mastodon
üîó Conda Community (https://linkedin.com/company/condacommunity) on LinkedInAnnouncement: https://conda.org/blog/2023-12-27-social-move
We hope to see you on Mastodon and LinkedIn in 2024!

item.title: Anne Applebaum
item.description:
"The push to seize Russian sovereign assets reflects a shared desire to show Moscow that it would not be able to outlast western resolve to aid Ukraine, both economically and militarily" Yes - and this is why Russians are struggling so hard against it

item.title: Anirvan Chatterjee
item.description: ‚ÄúAbout 85% of Gaza‚Äôs 2.3 million people have been displaced from their homes ‚Äì many, like Jameel, multiple times, and the UN‚Äôs latest food security assessment estimates that one in four people in Gaza are starving.‚Äù[üëÜI updated this quote to reflect the correct ‚Äúone in four‚Äù number after the Guardian printed a correction]https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/dec/27/miserable-in-every-sense-displaced-families-in-gaza-face-daily-ordeal

item.title: Troed S√•ngberg
item.description: @anirvan "This article was amended on 28 December 2023. An earlier version said the UN‚Äôs latest food security assessment estimated that 90% of people in Gaza were starving. That was the percentage of people who had not eaten for two days in the period leading up to 7 December. The latest figures suggest one in four people are now starving."Still bad.

item.title: Qasim Rashid, Esq.
item.description: Let‚Äôs be clear. Palestinian journalists said this since Day 1 and those who believed them were ridiculed or called antisemitic.Now the NYT confirms ‚ÄúIsrael claims it protects civilians, but a NYT investigation found at least 200 times Israel dropped its most destructive bombs in areas it designated as safe for civilians in Gaza.‚ÄùThat‚Äôs no accident‚Äîit‚Äôs policy. Where is the accountability? #CeasefireNOW

item.title: petersuber
item.description:
New study: "Within 3-5 years from their publication, two-thirds of #ClinicalTrials published in the top medical journals lifted the #embargoes for #data sharing that they had stated in their original data sharing statements. This shift toward greater openness is a positive development."
https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2813597
(#paywalled)#Medicine #OpenData

item.title: Dan Neidle
item.description: Last year, the Times and then The Daily Mirror reported that Douglas Barrowman and Michelle Mone owned (and sometimes lived in) a house in Belgravia which was held by an offshore trust.Which means she was a beneficiary (or the trustees acted in breach of trust).Guess whether Mone disclosed her interest in the trust in the House of Lords register of members' interests? https://www.taxpolicy.org.uk/2023/12/29/more_mone/

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: I'm no cell-biologist, but the membrane mechanisms implied by microglia "pruning" synapses always seem unnecessarily complex. What's wrong with resorption and recycling? Why involve non-neuronal cells in what is likely an activity-dependent decision?And the statistics of this article very much do not inspire confidence. I'd like to believe that Science would not publish such bizarre statistics today. And maybe even that Harvard researchers wouldn't try to.https://pubpeer.com/publications/9775AFC4086EF678B10238F0594B07#

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: It's the time of the year for picking the top science stories of 2023. There were triumphs, yes. But for my newsletter, I picked a different kind of story: the struggle to bring back the American chestnut tree, and what it really takes to address the extinction crisis. https://buttondown.email/carlzimmer/archive/fridays-elk-december-29-2023/

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: PS: You can subscribe to my email newsletter here: https://buttondown.email/carlzimmer

item.title: Shannon Skinner (she/her)
item.description:
Profit is antithetical to positive healthcare outcomes. Period. End of story. Researchers examined Medicare claims for 662,095 patients at 51 different hospitals owned by private equity firms and compared the outcomes to those of more than 4 million hospitalizations at 259 hospitals that were not owned by private equity firms:At private equity firm hospitals:* 25.4% increase in hospital-acquired conditions
* 27% increase in falls
* 38% increase in central line infections despite performing 16% fewer percutaneous central lines
* 100% increase in surgical site infections despite 8% fewer surgeries
* And all despite treating younger and therefore presumably healthier patientshttps://skepchick.org/2023/12/the-guys-who-killed-toys-r-us-are-coming-for-doctors/#HealthcareIsAHumanRight #SinglePayerNow #MedicareForAll #USPol #USPolitics #GetProfitOutOfHealthcare #PrivateEquity #Finance
